title: Not happy

But instead I've learned that I only get the 75 dollars once every three months So I was basically lied to, or maybe I misheard Mr. Labrado anyway I am most dissatisfied with this decision to go with Humana and this plan I will consider changing if possible.

title: This company now (Liz) gave us a wrong…
text: This company now (Liz) gave us a wrong quote on this insurance!!!!   She said my Ozempic wud be $47 a month until I fell in the “hole”.    Ozempic is very hard to find now but the CVS found me a box.  Suckered me into $197!!!!! Says there is a $150 on first prescription. Including the $47!!    NO ONE ——- ever gave that quote    Liz said the insurance company was wrong.  Said we shud call her and she wud call them with us on the phone      Well three calls to her now since Friday we keep leaving messages and we get no call backs.   Was this an easy sell for UHC      We are in a fixed income and can’t afford this as is is let alone surprises from anyone.   Now on the phone waiting for UHC to get someone to talk to —- about half an hour already.   Not a good way to start with a new insurance company!!!!!

title: i though I signed up to have the…

title: I agreed to listen and consider…
text: I agreed to listen and consider switching my health insurance but wasn't ready just yet. Your company switched my insurance anyway. NOT HAPPY!!

title: I inadvertently initiated contact with…
text: I inadvertently initiated contact with this company while trying to compare Medicare Advantage plans.  Despite the fact that I have repeatedly requested that they remove me from their calling, since November 15, 2022   they have continued to call my home 2-3 times a day, hang up abruptly when I ask them not to call again, and immediately call right back.  This is deliberate harassment and the company management should monitor their employees more closely to ensure this does not continue.  I am on the Missouri No-call list and I have filed a formal complaint.  Hopefully, this will end the harassing  phone calls from this company

title: These bags start calling at 8 a.m.

title: Th insurance in Texas is no goode reason I gave you are one star is…
text: The reason I gave you are one star is because every time I call to speak to a supervisor nobody gets me to that point every damn representative tries to help me because they want to get paid you know what if I have money I would get regular insurance instead of being on Medicaid Medicare in the state of Texas and by the way Medicare and Medicaid in the state of Texas doesn't even cover anything for you but if you were in Phoenix Arizona hell yeah I'll cover everything 100% everything it is so sad that the people of Texas have to go through what they're going through after all these years that they have worked and put into the system it's a crying shame

title: Repeated phone solicitation attempts
text: I only have experience with Ensurem in the context of their calling REPEATEDLY without ever leaving a voicemail. I am on the NDNCL and when I politely informed them of that, the CSR was rather rude and hung up on me. We shall see if the calls stop.

title: Didn't received proper forms to sign

title: Complaint
text: Did not follow what I asked for and has create a mess in my medical care.  I have been trying multiple times to fix the issue to no avail.

title: Why did I switch?
text: I had a plan and was happy, then I got a call and said that if I didn't have a Medicare plan with prescription drug coverage, I would be in violation of the Medicare law.  I changed plans, now I have to pay thirty some odd dollars a month for this recommended plan.  I said I didn't like that idea, and was told that I should go back to the plan I used to have, so I don't have to pay the penalty, I am more confused than ever.

title: Reprehensive set up plan and the agent…
text: Reprehensive set up plan and the agent never called to close.  Called back several times.   at one point a manager said she would step in and never did.  Please review your notes it was a fiasco, and I'm still don't have that coverage.  A review of your practices may be in order.  Thank you for asking.  However  I do believe this will go into the land of the abyss .  Thank you for asking.

title: Your constant messages and phonecalls…
text: Your constant messages and phonecalls asking "how you are doing" are annoying as hell when all I have gotten so far is a couple if letters saying "thanks, you have insurance, we will mail you more soon". I don't have an UD card yet, I have not had a need to use the insurance yet.OH MY GOD! In the middle if writing this you just CALLED me, too!!! I went off on the poor lady calling me.Why ask for a review of my own message if you are NOT going to respond?

title: Nothing and they we're good help

title: I switched because the previous…Duped and Stuck
text: I switched because the previous insurance company didn’t not provide what was needed for my mother. I was told that the current insurance company would provide 35 hours of home care for companionship. That was an exaggeration at best. They don’t provide anything, nothing! They would if it was Medicaid. Now, my mom is in a situation with no home care, there was no reason to change. This is everything I didn’t want. I asked several times and told the rep how happy I was. I am so beyond unhappy. I changed insurance companies specifically for this reason. I needed these needs to be met. And nothing. I found out when the nurse came to do the assessment. She said that because  my mother is able to bathe herself and feed herself and basically care for herself, that she doesn’t need assistance. This is exactly why I switched to you, so this wouldn’t happen, it happened before.I’m just done and over this entire ordeal. Switching disrupts everything, with the pharmacy, co pays, learning about this company, etc and for what? The only thing that changed is the insurance company. Duped and stuck!

title: Very Very Unhappy with the service I received
text: I needed to move my 87 year old mother from Louisiana to California where I could take care of her. I asked the agent, Yvonne Henderson, for only 2 things.1. I need an affordable plan that will cover my mother in California2. I need a plan that is contracted with Loma Linda University Health in network so that all her care needs can be well coordinatedThat is all I asked!!!!! After many hours on the phone and getting transferred over and over, Yvonne Henderson assured me that the AARP Medicare Advantage Freedom Plus HMO-POS would cover California and Loma Linda University Health faculty physicians and surgeons was in-network as well a Loma Linda University Medical Center Hospital. I moved my mother to California feeling less than confident to find out my insecurities about the choice was well founded. This was all incorrect! LLUH doctors and hospital are not in network and they do not accept this plan. Now my sick mother is stuck in this plan and is assigned to some unknown PCP that we never asked for unless Myron A. Dace can escalate this to a point where she can be changed to the correct plan right away.The vital care that my mother needs is being delayed as we try to urgently enroll her in a plan that fits the description that I asked for in the first place.

title: I spent quite a bit of time with an…
text: I spent quite a bit of time with an agent, told her I needed some time to make a decision. She said she'd keep all the information until I make a decision. I called today, she seemed quite agitated or irritated, saying that we spent over an hour on the phone going over everything approximately a week or so ago. She assumed I had picked United healthcare in fact I told her I did not make a decision and that is why I was calling back today. I needed more information about several other plans to get all of my doctors under the same Medicare advantage plan. She seemed in a hurry and told me she would call me back. I told her okay it can wait until Monday. Then I realized she did not understand at all what I was trying to do because she several times reminded me that we went over this in our first call. I specifically told her I did not make a decision that day. And I was calling today hoping to make a decision on which plan I wanted to take depending on whether my doctors were in those plans Network. She seemed in a hurry to get off the phone and so we hung up. I decided to go with a different insurance company because I felt she misunderstood our first conversation and I really didn't want to go over everything, I just wanted to find out about two other possibilities. Then I would make a decision. So I did not get a permanent answer and not satisfied. I called back and a different person answered started to explain to her why I am choosing another company. And to let the previous agent know not to call me back. Then all of a sudden I was hung up on. I thought maybe it was a mistake and she would call me back but did not. I tried again and called this time the agent that I was working with answered the phone. Apparently she was not too busy after all. I am very disappointed in feeling rushed and that they expected me to make an a decision without going through my questions. She did not remember our conversation prior to today's correctly. Very disappointed and cannot believe I was hung up on without trying to make the situation better it was made worse by being disrespectful. Letty you had time to answer the phone but you had no time to work with me. Try putting yourself in my situation and others maybe you will have patience for the elderly or disabled. I cannot recommend this insurance company. Not willing to give the required time that it takes to reassure a customer.
